# RefinanceHomeLoanMY.com

> Malaysia's comprehensive home loan refinancing comparison platform. Free calculators, bank comparisons, and expert guidance for Malaysians looking to refinance their home loans.

## What We Offer
- Free refinancing calculators (savings, DSR, eligibility)
- Bank-by-bank comparison (Maybank, CIMB, Public Bank, RHB, Hong Leong, AmBank, UOB)
- Cash-out refinancing guidance
- Debt consolidation options
- Expert consultation (free)

## Quick Answers

### How much can I save by refinancing in Malaysia?
Typically RM300-700 per month by switching from 4.5% to 3.85% interest rate. On a RM500,000 loan, that's RM200-300/month or RM60,000+ over remaining tenure.

### What is the best bank for refinancing in Malaysia 2026?
Public Bank (lowest rates ~3.85%), Maybank (highest margin 90%, MaxiHome), CIMB (flexible for self-employed), Hong Leong (accepts higher DSR up to 75%).

### What DSR is needed for refinancing?
Most banks require DSR below 70%. Hong Leong accepts up to 75%. Calculate yours at /dsr-calculator.

### Can I refinance if my loan was rejected?
Yes, different banks have different criteria. Self-employed should try CIMB, high DSR try Hong Leong. See /home-loan-rejected-malaysia for guidance.

### What documents are needed for refinancing?
IC, 3 months payslips, 3 months bank statements, EPF statement, current loan statement, property documents. Full list at /en/documents-required.

## About
RefinanceHomeLoanMY.com helps Malaysian homeowners find better home loan rates. We compare 15+ banks, provide free calculators, and connect users with licensed refinancing specialists for free consultations.

## Contact
Free consultation available for Malaysian homeowners.
